description: Real-time vulnerability scanning for dependencies with automated CVE detection, severity assessment, and patch recommendations
author: JSONbored
features: Automated vulnerability scanning on dependency file changes
CVE database integration for real-time threat detection
Support for npm, yarn, pip, cargo, go modules
License compliance checking and risk assessment

configuration.scriptContent:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Read the tool input from stdin
INPUT=$(cat)
TOOL_NAME=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_name')
FILE_PATH=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_input.file_path // .tool_input.path // ""')

if [ -z "$FILE_PATH" ]; then
  exit 0
fi

# Configuration
SECURITY_REPORT=".claude/reports/security-scan-$(date +%Y%m%d).txt"
SEVERITY_THRESHOLD=${SEVERITY_THRESHOLD:-medium}

mkdir -p "$(dirname "$SECURITY_REPORT")"

# Function to check if file is a dependency manifest
is_dependency_file() {
  local file=$1
  
  case "$(basename "$file")" in
    package.json|package-lock.json|yarn.lock|pnpm-lock.yaml)
      echo "npm"
      return 0
      ;;
    requirements.txt|Pipfile|Pipfile.lock|poetry.lock)
      echo "pip"
      return 0
      ;;
    Cargo.toml|Cargo.lock)
      echo "cargo"
      return 0
      ;;
    go.mod|go.sum)
      echo "go"
      return 0
      ;;
    Gemfile|Gemfile.lock)
      echo "bundler"
      return 0
      ;;
    composer.json|composer.lock)
      echo "composer"
      return 0
      ;;
    *)
      return 1
      ;;
  esac
}

# Function to run npm audit
scan_npm_dependencies() {
  echo "ðŸ“¦ Scanning npm dependencies for vulnerabilities..." >&2
  
  if ! command -v npm &> /dev/null; then
    echo "âš ï¸ npm not found - install Node.js for security scanning" >&2
    return
  fi
  
  echo "" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
  echo "NPM Audit Report - $(date)" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
  echo "================================" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
  
  # Run npm audit
  AUDIT_OUTPUT=$(npm audit --json 2>/dev/null)
  
  if [ -n "$AUDIT_OUTPUT" ]; then
    # Parse vulnerabilities
    CRITICAL=$(echo "$AUDIT_OUTPUT" | jq -r '.metadata.vulnerabilities.critical // 0')
    HIGH=$(echo "$AUDIT_OUTPUT" | jq -r '.metadata.vulnerabilities.high // 0')
    MODERATE=$(echo "$AUDIT_OUTPUT" | jq -r '.metadata.vulnerabilities.moderate // 0')
    LOW=$(echo "$AUDIT_OUTPUT" | jq -r '.metadata.vulnerabilities.low // 0')
    
    echo "Critical: $CRITICAL | High: $HIGH | Moderate: $MODERATE | Low: $LOW" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
    
    # Alert on critical/high vulnerabilities
    if [ "$CRITICAL" -gt 0 ] || [ "$HIGH" -gt 0 ]; then
      echo "" >&2
      echo "ðŸš¨ SECURITY ALERT: Critical or High severity vulnerabilities detected!" >&2
      echo "   Critical: $CRITICAL vulnerabilities" >&2
      echo "   High: $HIGH vulnerabilities" >&2
      echo "" >&2
      echo "ðŸ”§ Run 'npm audit fix' to automatically fix vulnerabilities" >&2
      echo "ðŸ”§ Run 'npm audit fix --force' for breaking changes" >&2
    fi
    
    # Get fixable vulnerabilities
    FIXABLE=$(echo "$AUDIT_OUTPUT" | jq -r '.metadata.vulnerabilities.info // 0')
    if [ "$FIXABLE" -gt 0 ]; then
      echo "ðŸ’¡ $FIXABLE vulnerabilities can be fixed automatically" >&2
    fi
  else
    echo "âœ… No vulnerabilities detected" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
  fi
}

# Function to scan Python dependencies
scan_pip_dependencies() {
  echo "ðŸ Scanning Python dependencies for vulnerabilities..." >&2
  
  if command -v safety &> /dev/null; then
    echo "" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
    echo "Python Safety Report - $(date)" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
    echo "=================================" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
    
    safety check --json 2>/dev/null | \
      jq -r '.[] | "\(.package): \(.vulnerability)"' 2>/dev/null >> "$SECURITY_REPORT" || \
      echo "âœ… No vulnerabilities detected" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
  elif command -v pip-audit &> /dev/null; then
    echo "Running pip-audit..." >&2
    pip-audit --format json 2>/dev/null >> "$SECURITY_REPORT" || \
      echo "ðŸ’¡ Install pip-audit: pip install pip-audit" >&2
  else
    echo "ðŸ’¡ Install safety or pip-audit for Python security scanning" >&2
  fi
}

# Function to scan Rust dependencies
scan_cargo_dependencies() {
  echo "ðŸ¦€ Scanning Rust dependencies for vulnerabilities..." >&2
  
  if command -v cargo &> /dev/null; then
    if cargo audit --version &> /dev/null; then
      echo "" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
      echo "Cargo Audit Report - $(date)" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
      echo "==============================" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
      
      cargo audit --json 2>/dev/null >> "$SECURITY_REPORT" || \
        echo "âœ… No vulnerabilities detected" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
    else
      echo "ðŸ’¡ Install cargo-audit: cargo install cargo-audit" >&2
    fi
  fi
}

# Function to scan Go dependencies
scan_go_dependencies() {
  echo "ðŸ¹ Scanning Go dependencies for vulnerabilities..." >&2
  
  if command -v govulncheck &> /dev/null; then
    echo "" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
    echo "Go Vulnerability Check - $(date)" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
    echo "==================================" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
    
    govulncheck ./... 2>/dev/null >> "$SECURITY_REPORT" || \
      echo "âœ… No vulnerabilities detected" >> "$SECURITY_REPORT"
  else
    echo "ðŸ’¡ Install govulncheck: go install golang.org/x/vuln/cmd/govulncheck@latest" >&2
  fi
}

# Main execution
DEP_TYPE=$(is_dependency_file "$FILE_PATH")

if [ -n "$DEP_TYPE" ]; then
  echo "ðŸ” Security scan triggered: $FILE_PATH" >&2
  echo "ðŸ“‹ Dependency type: $DEP_TYPE" >&2
  
  # Run appropriate scanner
  case "$DEP_TYPE" in
    npm)
      scan_npm_dependencies
      ;;
    pip)
      scan_pip_dependencies
      ;;
    cargo)
      scan_cargo_dependencies
      ;;
    go)
      scan_go_dependencies
      ;;
    *)
      echo "ðŸ’¡ Security scanning available for: npm, pip, cargo, go" >&2
      ;;
  esac
  
  # General security tips
  echo "" >&2
  echo "ðŸ›¡ï¸ Dependency Security Best Practices:" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Keep dependencies updated regularly" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Review security advisories before updates" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Use lock files to ensure reproducible builds" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Minimize dependency count to reduce attack surface" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Enable automated security alerts in your repo" >&2
  
  if [ -s "$SECURITY_REPORT" ]; then
    echo "" >&2
    echo "ðŸ“„ Security report: $SECURITY_REPORT" >&2
  fi
fi

exit 0

useCases: Continuous security monitoring during dependency updates
CI/CD pipeline integration for automated vulnerability detection
Real-time CVE alerting on new vulnerabilities

troubleshooting.issue: PostToolUse hook triggers but npm audit shows empty results
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure package-lock.json exists (run npm install first). Check npm version supports audit (npm 6+). Verify network connectivity for CVE database access. Try npm audit --registry=https://registry.npmjs.org.

troubleshooting.issue: Critical vulnerabilities reported but npm audit fix fails
troubleshooting.solution: Breaking changes require --force flag but review impact first. Check if vulnerability is in transitive dependency requiring upstream fix. Pin vulnerable package version with resolutions in package.json. Consider alternative packages.

troubleshooting.issue: Python safety check reports vulnerabilities in dev packages
troubleshooting.solution: Separate dev and prod requirements: safety check -r requirements.txt. Use --ignore to suppress false positives. Check if vulnerability affects your usage context. Update to patched versions in requirements.txt.

troubleshooting.issue: Security scan creates duplicate reports on each save
troubleshooting.solution: Hook runs on every write/edit matcher trigger. Implement debouncing with timestamp check. Use daily report files to prevent spam. Add file hash check to skip scans if content unchanged.

troubleshooting.issue: Cargo audit fails with index update errors in CI
troubleshooting.solution: Pre-download advisory database: cargo audit fetch in CI setup. Use offline mode if network restricted. Cache advisory-db directory between runs. Check firewall rules for https://github.com/rustsec access.
